Jalapeño-Honeydew Hot Sauce Recipe | Bon Appetit




















































Close Menu IconLoginRecipesCookingCultureShoppingRestaurantsBA MarketVideosPodcastSubscribe to our newsletterSign UpPrivacy and user agreementMain Navigation IconBA LogoBon appetitLoginhealthyishJalapeño-Honeydew Hot SauceSponsored by VitamixFacebookPinterestTwitterEmailJerrelle GuyTry making your own fermented jalapeño-honeydew hot sauce and add a delicious kick to a variety of dishes.PrintIngredients.35 lbs. honeydew meat (about 1 cup).35 lbs. of organic green seeded jalapeños (about 5 jalapeños)1 seeded habanero pepper¼ cup distilled white vinegar2 small or 1 large garlic clove(s)1 tsp. brown sugar¼ tsp. saltRecipe PreparationChop the honeydew, jalapeño, and habanero peppers finely. Add to the Vitamix Personal Cup Adaptor along with white vinegar, garlic, brown sugar, and salt.  Attach the Personal Cup Adaptor to the Vitamix Adaptor Base. Blend all ingredients in the Vitamix E310  Blender for one minute starting on level 1 and slowly progressing to level 4 until pureed. Allow the bubbles in the mixture to settle completely (this may take about an hour) before transferring into an airtight mason jar. Keep in a warm, dark place for 4–7 days, stirring daily until the sauce starts bubbling and begins to ferment.Once the hot sauce has fermented, pour it back into the Vitamix Personal Cup Adaptor and blend on level 1, increasing to level 2 for about 30 seconds until frothy. Strain through a sieve into a medium saucepan, and discard any remaining pulp. Bring to a boil and cook for 15–20 minutes or until the sauce reduces by half.
